meanings.definition: The SI unit of electrical capacitance, equal to one coulomb per volt.
meanings.sent1: A farad measures how much electricity a device can store.
meanings.sent2: The capacitor has a capacitance of one farad.
meanings.sent3: Why did the capacitor break up with the resistor? Because it couldn't handle the farad commitment!
meanings.sent4: Her love for electronics was like a farad, always ready to store new memories.
meanings.sent5: The farad is like a big battery, holding onto electrical energy until needed.

meanings.definition: A unit of electrical charge equal to one coulomb per volt.
meanings.sent1: The farad is a measure of how much charge a capacitor can hold.
meanings.sent2: He calculated the charge in farads for the experiment.
meanings.sent3: Why did the electron bring a flashlight to the party? To amp up the farad!
meanings.sent4: The farad of excitement in the air was palpable as the experiment began.
meanings.sent5: The farad of energy in the circuit was enough to power the entire lab.
